result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Cefalu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-False Representation>$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $2500 fine plus costs. If not paid in full within 6 months, stay on jail sentence will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 3/6/17, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 3/6/17, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 180 days from sentencing date to report.

Attorneys Howard Barry Mitz and Susan Ross appeared by phone on behalf of Defendant. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Motion for Reconsideration, Brief and Response. Atty Ross makes statement regarding statute under which motion is made, advises of correction to brief, rests on arguments as presented in brief. State will rely upon prior response. Court makes statement, denies motion.

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, previous activity. State offers exhibit 1 - Certified JOC 99CM475, Ozaukee County; exhibit 2 - 10CM153 Complaint. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). State/Defense present rebuttal argument. Testimony taken from Gerry MacMillin. Court advises of e-mail received in support of Defendant. Defense has all witnesses in support of Defendant identity themselves. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Bond no longer in effect.

State's Closing argument and proposed findings of fact and conclusions of law

Day 2 - Defense advises that Defendant will not testify. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver of right to testify made freely and voluntarily. Defense makes statement. Defense has no further witnesses. State will not be calling any rebuttal witnesses. Court makes statement about findings required at jury trial, will let Counsel to decide how they would like to proceed. Counsel would prefer to do written arguments. State's due by 7/17, Defense due by 8/17, State's rebuttal by 8/31. Discussion regarding applicable jury instructions.
on Defendant's Motions in Limine

Day 1 - Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz and William Baker. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews waiver of jury trial, questions Defendant, finds waiver of jury trial made freely and voluntarily. Court signs Order on Defendant's Motions in Limine as presented. Discussion regarding opening arguments, Court's review of co-Defendant's file, key issues that should be addressed in written closing arguments. Defense requests sequestration. Court will not order sequestration, orders witnesses excluded from courtroom with directions not to discuss case. Defense renews motions to dismiss. Testimony taken.
of Trial by Jury

from Defense to State regarding contact with Glenn Longley
Copy of letter from ADA Korb to Atty Hank Schultz dated 4/29/15 regarding the proposed proffer language.

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Mitz withdraws their motion to preclude immunity of Orland Helt. Discussion regarding motion in limine regarding testimony of Mr. Longley. State met with law enforcement and Mr. Longley last week, has not received the report from Sgt. Henry yet. State will have report sent to Atty Mitz as soon as it is provided to their office. Atty Mitz would like to move trial to November to allow additional time for discovery issues. Court not moving trial, matter has been pending long enough, need to get it finished. Court orders motion/discovery issues to be finished a week before trial. Atty Mitz will draft order in accordance with todays rulings. Bond remains in effect.

Jury trial at 06-16-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court. Attorney Howard Barry Mitz appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense's Order to Show Cause regarding trial date. Court reviews Affidavit, questions what witnesses will be testifying about. State makes statement regarding witnesses, advises that they were named on witness list. Court questions Defense on what is in witness statements that necessitates moving trial. Defense makes statement regarding scheduling order, lack of decision on Motions on limine. State addresses timing of filings. Defense is not prepared to argue motions in limine today, is only prepared to argue motion to move trial date. Court advises that next #1 trial date is November. Defense will take #2. State will advise Defense regarding testimony of co-Defendant. Court questions criminal records of witnesses. Court grants motion to adjourn trial.

from Atty Mitz in response to State's letter regarding order in which cases should be tried

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court. Attorney Howard Barry Mitz appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews purpose of hearing, letters from State/Defense. Court make statement, thinks deference should be given to State in how they wish to proceed, will have this case go first. Discussion regarding scheduling. Pretrial motions to be filed by first week of February, 3 weeks to respond, 10 days to reply, hearing can be requested if necessary.
of Motion hearing held 9/29/14
from State presenting argument regarding order of trials

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court. Attorney Howard Barry Mitz appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews State's motion to join, brief by Defense in opposition. Atty Schultz believes risk is significant that one Defendant will not receive a fair trial due to antagonistic defense. Atty Korb responds. Atty Schultz responds. Atty Mitz responds. Court makes statement, thinks it would be cleaner to do 2 trials, denies motion, will set each case for trial. Atty Korb will advise JA which should be set first. Atty Mitz would prefer to go second. Atty Korb's first instinct was to have Mr. Cefalu go first. Atty Schultz is not prepared to argue either way. Atty Korb to submit letter to Court regarding which case should be set first. Counsel will be given time to respond. Court hopes to be able to do scheduling by end of week. Court will set for 2 days trial and pre-trial. Motions due 3 weeks before pre-trial. Atty Korb discusses possibility of immunity for Mr. Helt's testimony. Atty Schultz responds. Atty Korb's letter due by 10/3, responses due by 10/8.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.
of Attorney Howard B. Mitz in Support of Defendant's Opposition to Plaintiff's Motion to Join Defendants Pursuant to Sec. 971.12(4) Wis. Stats.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Discussion regarding joinder. Defense would like to respond in writing. Court will allow Defense to appear by phone, Defendant can appear by phone. State addresses Motion to Dismiss filed by Defense. Court denies motion to dismiss. Bond continues as is. Motions to be filed by 9/1 or if late discovery, Defense can request extension.
by State

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Howard B Mitz.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense files motion to dismiss. Testimony taken. Defense makes argument. State makes argument. Defense presents rebuttal argument. Court finds probable cause, binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Mark P Howe on behalf of Howard Mitz. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense agrees that parties can be joined for prelim.   Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court questions whether motion to dismiss mentioned in March is going to be filed.  Defense advises motion to dismiss will be filed at close of prelim.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
by State to Join Defendants pursuant to Sec. 971.12(4) Wis. Stats.

Defendant Michael A Cefalu in court with attorney Mark P. Howe.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Howe advises of motion to dismiss that is being prepared by Atty Mitz.  Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
